summary: This document appears to be an FBI interview summary (302 form) with a Supervisory Correctional Systems Specialist at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). The interviewee discusses her role, the procedures for inmate transfers, and the events surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's transfer from the Special Housing Unit (SHU) on August 9, 2019. She reveals she initially believed Epstein went to court and only learned he was transferred during this interview.

persons.name: Deemo
persons.context: Identified as the supervisor of the interviewee. He works out of the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC).

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased inmate whose transfer procedures from the MCC SHU on August 9, 2019, are the subject of the interview.

connections.description: Deemo is identified as the supervisor of the interviewee.

events.title: Epstein's Transfer from MCC SHU
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was transferred from the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). The transfer was documented as a 'Pre-Remove' (WAB - Will Accompany Below), indicating he was not returning, as opposed to going to court.

events.title: Staff Called In After Epstein Found
events.description: All staff were called into work on Saturday, August 10, 2019, after Jeffrey Epstein was found deceased in his cell.

events.title: USMS Transfer Emails
events.description: The U.S. Marshals Service (USMS) sent emails on August 8, 2019, indicating Epstein was being transferred from the MCC to a GEO facility.

locations: R & D (Receiving and Discharge) at MCC
keyFacts: The interviewee, a supervisor at MCC, stated she initially believed Epstein went to court on August 9, 2019, and only learned during this interview that he was actually transferred (WAB/Pre-Remove).
Standard procedure required the SHU Lieutenant (LT) or Operations LT to authorize an inmate's key-out from SHU to R&D; SHU staff could not do it themselves.
The interviewee expressed surprise that a staff member (Tova Noel) allegedly did not perform inmate counts, calling it 'Corrections 101.'
Court lists and transfer documents like the '64' transit form were not maintained; they were typically deleted or discarded after use.
If an inmate listed as WAB (not returning) left SHU, it was not acceptable for SHU staff to think the inmate might return; they should have known.
